title: Himynameischris
author: Himynameischris
content: Just wondering if my account has any value Daily wheel gives a 2 minimum $1000 locked bcd always a few hundred here and there giveaway 20% cash backeven hitting coco gives me just under $2 every timea bot would realistically collect you about $7.50 a dayJust wondering.Thank you

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: Quote from: Himynameischris on December 30, 2022, 02:28:49 PMJust wondering if my account has any value Daily wheel gives a 2 minimum $1000 locked bcd always a few hundred here and there giveaway 20% cash backeven hitting coco gives me just under $2 every timea bot would realistically collect you about $7.50 a dayJust wondering.Thank you    - You should take action on that as soon as possible Op because it is also a big cost, it is not unlikely that what happened to others will happen to you before. Even more so is the amount that can come back to you every day.Then the 2$ per hour is also a big deal and 20% cashback is also a really big deal, mate.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Himynameischris on December 30, 2022, 02:28:49 PMJust wondering if my account has any value <...>I would say that your account has the most value for you alone.I don't want to discourage you from trying to sell your account, but this type of transaction is basically gambling because there is no guarantee that the casino won't figure it out and freeze/close the account. Even if they don't, the best the buyer can hope for is to get back their money + whatever they could gain from bonuses after buying it. If there are checks for change of IP address and whatnot, then it's definitely not worth taking the chance.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Account sell only favours the seller since he will have double chances of getting paid for the account from the buyer and also the possibility of you recovering the account back to yourself, but that will likely not happen in a decentralized casino where KYC is not demanded from players.But aside from that we also have several reasons why account sales are prohibited not only for casino accounts but every other account be it social media or forum accounts, because the new owner may run into troubles later on due to the activities of the old account owner, that is why everyone will advise you to claim your cashback and other benefits yourself and try to operate the account in the best possible way that will suit you instead sell.Casinos have KYC lately which makes it hard for third-party transfer of ownership of the account.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: You want to sell your gambling account? This is ridiculous and only fools will buy it. You need to check the ToS of gambling sites, it is always stated that their customers should not have two accounts, not to talk of having more accounts, while also that selling of account is against gambling sites ToS.If you are done with your account, just leave it like that.

comments.author: Unsoldier
comments.body: Newbie registered an account on the forum and he writes about his casino account in the first post. I think the OP wants to attract the attention of forum members and then sell them a casino account. I don't trust the OP and I urge caution. You risk losing your money by buying other people's accounts.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Seems you are asking if your account has value. That makes us think or you may say assumed that you are asking for your account's value because you are planning to sell your account. In my opinion, there is nothing wrong selling your account even if you say you are an honest seller but selling accounts in bitcointalk forum is not allowed. Well, they can create their own account with their own KYC information if KYC is necessary and also safe from being reported stolen as sold accounts can be reported to the site where the account id registered as stolen or hacked account and the buyer can't do anything at all. I would say your account doesn't have value for other people or the buyer of the account and only to yourself that it has a value since you know or can say that you have spent decent amount of money using your account. Once again, your account does have value as far as I can say but it's value might be nothing if it is sold since if there's a buyer then that person may ask to bargain price. Good luck.

comments.author: DiMarxist
comments.body: Quote from: Himynameischris on December 30, 2022, 02:28:49 PMJust wondering if my account has any value Daily wheel gives a 2 minimum $1000 locked bcd always a few hundred here and there giveaway 20% cash backeven hitting coco gives me just under $2 every timea bot would realistically collect you about $7.50 a dayJust wondering.Thank youWhat is your main point here. I really didn't get what you are trying to say. Which of your account are you talking about? Is it this forum account or your casino account? Please be specific and precise. The way I understand your point is all about your casino account which you are planning to sell. And if that is the truth then it is impossible because your KYC will be different from the buyer's details.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: Unsoldier on December 30, 2022, 04:34:10 PMNewbie registered an account on the forum and he writes about his casino account in the first post. I think the OP wants to attract the attention of forum members and then sell them a casino account. I don't trust the OP and I urge caution. You risk losing your money by buying other people's accounts.He can just simply post a sale thread on the marketplace if his goal is to sell his account here. I think he is asking honestly a proper valuation of his account or if it’s possible to sell. It’s normal for a non forum member that playing on one of casino that has ANN thread here to create a new account if they want to ask a casino related topics since Bitcointalk is the most active forum to discuss this matter.Answering OP. Selling of the account is strictly prohibited by the casino. Your account has no value considering it’s illegal to sell because all its benefits will be forfeited once the ownership is transferred.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: Himynameischris on December 30, 2022, 02:28:49 PMJust wondering if my account has any value Daily wheel gives a 2 minimum $1000 locked bcd always a few hundred here and there giveaway 20% cash backeven hitting coco gives me just under $2 every timea bot would realistically collect you about $7.50 a dayJust wondering.Thank youI think there is hardly anyone who wants to buy an account with KYC passed, although you have not indicated whether you really passed it, it can simply cause the new owner to be blocked and this risk can only be justified by the low price of the account.

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: Himynameischris on December 30, 2022, 02:28:49 PMJust wondering if my account has any value Daily wheel gives a 2 minimum $1000 locked bcd always a few hundred here and there giveaway 20% cash backeven hitting coco gives me just under $2 every timea bot would realistically collect you about $7.50 a dayJust wondering.Thank youMost of the time (if not always), selling an account is prohibited. You should be aware of that. Also, for those who are interested, you should keep that in mind. Quote from: Wapfika on December 30, 2022, 02:32:12 PM<snip just claiming the bonuses in the casino without playing.Is this even possible? As far as I know, you can only be continuously eligible for bonuses if you play and meet the minimum requirements.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: Daltonik on December 31, 2022, 01:11:49 PMQuote from: Himynameischris on December 30, 2022, 02:28:49 PMJust wondering if my account has any value Daily wheel gives a 2 minimum $1000 locked bcd always a few hundred here and there giveaway 20% cash backeven hitting coco gives me just under $2 every timea bot would realistically collect you about $7.50 a dayJust wondering.Thank youI think there is hardly anyone who wants to buy an account with KYC passed, although you have not indicated whether you really passed it, it can simply cause the new owner to be blocked and this risk can only be justified by the low price of the account.A higher VIP level means he already exceeds the allowable balance for non KYC user. The account is surely already undergo KYC in the past before when he reach the higher tier level. Other concerns on this kind of account was the benefits usually being removed when the account doesn’t play anymore with its normal wager volume when he reach that VIP level.Casino will obviously freeze or block the account as per terms if they feel that the user is not profitable for them casino is not a charity while this kind of passive daily bonus will surely noticed by the casino security team. Buying a casino account is very risky.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: Unsoldier on December 30, 2022, 04:34:10 PMNewbie registered an account on the forum and he writes about his casino account in the first post. I think the OP wants to attract the attention of forum members and then sell them a casino account. I don't trust the OP and I urge caution. You risk losing your money by buying other people's accounts.Ya think? What was your 1st clue? Of course the guy is looking to sell his account Mr Obvious. Hopefully noone is dumb enough to inquire about the price as they will just be wasting their money when bc game figures it out and closes the account.

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: Maybe here is not the right place to sell your gambling account because the people here are very risky. Casinos can easily find people using other people's accounts and by carrying out a thorough check of the account, it can close the account easily so that the person who bought your account will no longer be able to access it.It's better for us to play using our account safely without any worries. Maybe you can create ads on other forums to sell your account.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Everyone will discourage you to sell that. Just keep on using it as it seems you really know a lot on how much you'll benefit from having it. There's no other people that will be happy to have it but only you since you've worked hard for it and basically, how long does it takes to obtain that amount you've mentioned? If it's not that much then just don't sell but keep it.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.created_time: December 31, 2022, 06:27:31 PMLast edit: December 31, 2022, 07:17:07 PM by Odusko
comments.body: Quote from: blockman on December 31, 2022, 03:14:01 PMEveryone will discourage you to sell that. Just keep on using it as it seems you really know a lot on how much you'll benefit from having it. There's no other people that will be happy to have it but only you since you've worked hard for it and basically, how long does it takes to obtain that amount you've mentioned? If it's not that much then just don't sell but keep it.Just like I have said before and as you have also made it clear oos is not going to get any offer in thos forum, since most members here are well aware of the implication of third-party ownership of an account. And at that the account is worthless and no one will waste the time or resources taking source risk. You have made the right suggestions to ops, the best ops can do is to continue to use his account since he is not going to get any offer here.

comments.author: iv4n
comments.body: Quote from: blockman on December 31, 2022, 03:14:01 PM...how long does it takes to obtain that amount you've mentioned? If it's not that much then just don't sell but keep it.Well, for SVIP 9 we need a 20.5M XP, which means we need to wager $20.5M dollars... I guess some people can do that in less than a month (I saw one guy doing it, with +$1M wagering daily...). But it's not about how long it takes, it's more about how much money you lost along the way and does bonuses you got (and BC has a lot of bonus drops for people who wager a lot) cover all that and brings some profit. By the way, I doubt that OP is the owner of this account in the first place.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: Odusko on December 31, 2022, 06:27:31 PMQuote from: blockman on December 31, 2022, 03:14:01 PMEveryone will discourage you to sell that. Just keep on using it as it seems you really know a lot on how much you'll benefit from having it. There's no other people that will be happy to have it but only you since you've worked hard for it and basically, how long does it takes to obtain that amount you've mentioned? If it's not that much then just don't sell but keep it.Just like I have said before and as you have also made it clear oos is not going to get any offer in thos forum, since most members here are well aware of the implication of third-party ownership of an account. And at that the account is worthless and no one will waste the time or resources taking source risk. You have made the right suggestions to ops, the best ops can do is to continue to use his account since he is not going to get any offer here. That's why he just has to use it and no need to sell it. Thinking of how much he has spent all over to reach that rank for his account.Quote from: iv4n on December 31, 2022, 11:08:30 PMQuote from: blockman on December 31, 2022, 03:14:01 PM...how long does it takes to obtain that amount you've mentioned? If it's not that much then just don't sell but keep it.Well, for SVIP 9 we need a 20.5M XP, which means we need to wager $20.5M dollars... I guess some people can do that in less than a month (I saw one guy doing it, with +$1M wagering daily...). But it's not about how long it takes, it's more about how much money you lost along the way and does bonuses you got (and BC has a lot of bonus drops for people who wager a lot) cover all that and brings some profit. By the way, I doubt that OP is the owner of this account in the first place. That's a lot then, it's likely that someone who has worked and wagered for it that much will not sell it. Knowing the effort and money that has lost on it will never make him sell it.Unless he really wants to sell it and just plainly accept all of those lost wagers that he had made. But thinking of all the efforts and bets he's made to reach that, is he really going to sell it that easily? And yes, likely he may not be the owner of it, and possibly that is just a commission sale if ever it goes successful.
